remarks: Foulis-Holland Theorem, part 1.  If any 2 pairs in a triple of orthomodular lattice elements commute, the triple is distributive.  Part of Theorem 5 in [Kalmbach] p. 25.  ( ~ fh1 analog.)  (Contributed by NM, 8-Nov-2011.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
omlfh1.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
omlfh1.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
omlfh1.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
omlfh1.c $e |- C = ( cm ` K ) $.
omlfh1N $p |- ( ( K e. OML /\ ( X e. B /\ Y e. B /\ Z e. B ) /\ ( X C Y /\ X C Z ) ) -> ( X ./\ ( Y .\/ Z ) ) = ( ( X ./\ Y ) .\/ ( X ./\ Z ) ) ) $.
